metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:process_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:process_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

Information regarding the processes on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start->Run... and by typing 'cmd'. Once a command prompt termial is open simply type 'WMIC PATH Win32_Process GET CommandLine , ProcessId , ParentProcessId , Priority , Name , ExecutablePath > Win32_ProcessOutput.txt'. The results of this query will be available in the text file 'Win32_ProcessOutput.txt' in the working directory of where the query was issued.
Also, when entering a value for the command_line entity be sure to include quotes if they are contained in some part of the value.

criterion.comment: Test that a process_object with a command_line is supported.
Test that a process_object with a command_line pattern match is supported.
Test that a process_object with a command_line not equals is supported.

process_test.comment: Test that a process_object with a command_line is supported.
Test that a process_object with a command_line pattern match is supported.
Test that a process_object with a command_line not equals is supported.

process_object.comment: Retrieve process_objects with a command_line value that is equal to 'winlogon.exe'.
Retrieve process_objects with a command_line value that matches the regular expression '.*'.
Retrieve process_objects with a command_line value that is not equal to 'winlogon.exe'.

process_state.comment: This state represents a process with a command_line value equal to 'winlogon.exe', has a pid greater than or equal to '0', a ppid greater than or equal to '0', a priority that matches the regular expression '.*', a image_path equal to 'winlogon.exe', and a current_dir that matches the regular expression '.*'.

This state represents a process with a command_line that matches the regular expression '.*', has a pid greater than or equal to '0', a ppid greater than or equal to '0', a priority that matches the regular expression '.*', a image_path that matches the regular expression '.*', and a current_dir that matches the regular expression '.*'.
